title: Resizing portrait mode photographs with ImageMagick -- almost no reduction in file size.
content:
I'm trying to reduce the size of some photographs for publication online.

I'm using this command with ImageMagick:
convert -resize 800 -quality 50 $p $p-small.jpg

This yields an image approximately 10% of original's file size -- with the exception of portrait mode images. Those images have a size and quality reduction, but their overall file size is still massive -- around 8MB for a low quality 800x600 shot.

Is there a recommended way to strip the extra data that these kinds images must be storing?
